page.title: 14STRAW BURNING-DISADVANTAGES
page.content: There are disadvantages for the general oublic and in an attempt to reduce these the{National Farmers {Union}issued a{straw burning code} which was followed in 1984 by{model {by_laws}laid down by the{Home Office.} They were intended to reduce smoke and ash in the air, to minimise the hazard of smoke on the Highways and to curb damage to the trees and hedge rows and wild life in them. Some of these hazards were the result of careless burning but many were caused by wind change and flying sparks. The by-laws carry a{maximum penalty of Â£2000}for each offence. Burning of straw and stubble is still legal but another method of disposal now used is to{incorporate {the straw}into the soil immediately after combining.
